title: Incentives.
description: How are interviewees incentivised?

title: NDA interviewee
description: Does the interviewee need to sign an NDA?

title: Interview location
description: Where do the interviews take place?

title: End user recruitment.
description: Who does the end user recruitment for user interviews?

title: Contact point customer?
description: Who in the team is the contact point for the customer?

title: Visuals in SVS?
description: Are visuals part of the SVS deliverables?

title: Prototypes in SVS?
description: Are prototypes part of the SVS deliverables?

title: Right people.
description: Can we have the right people to cover all aspects in the SVS: desirability, feasibility, viability?

title: Customer in SVS.
description: Who of the customer is part of the SVS and how much?

title: Customer in SVS
description: Is the customer part of the SVS?

title: Contact end users.
description: How can we contact the end users?

title: Unfettered access.
description: Can we contact the end users directly or does the customer act as proxy?

title: Access to end users.
description: Do we have direct access to end users?
help_text: Essential for SVS/concepting, important for other project types.

title: PM triangle
description: What are the constraints?
help_text: Schedule, Scope, Budget.

title: Outside scope
description: What is the biggest thing which is outside the scope of this project

title: Service in 1 year
description: What will the service be in 1 year, 2 years from now

title: All parts
description: Are all parts, required to make the service work, budgeted for?
help_text: All mobile platforms, back-end services, Gateways, CI systems, .....

title: Availability
description: What is the availability of the team members?

title: Waste
description: What has been the most wasteful activity so far?

title: Learning
description: If you had one week for somebody in the team to learn something. Who and what would that be?

title: Best thing
description: What has been the best decision we have made since the start of the project?

title: Twice as happy
description: If we could have done things differently, what would have made the customer twice as happy?

title: Recommend
description: What practise from this project would you recommend every single other project to adopt?

title: Concept history
description: Do we know how we ended up with the current concept?

title: Design approval
description: Are there any other parties in the customer organisation who have to approve the designs?

title: Business case
description: Have we challenged the business case?

title: Concept
description: Have we challenged the concept?

title: Challenge brand
description: Have we challenged the brand guidelines

title: Partial concept
description: Does the customer know which part of the concept will be implemented first?

title: Design review
description: Have the designs been reviewed by the developers/PO?

title: PS project
description: Is the Photoshop (or other design) project file on drive?

title: Share assets
description: How to we store/share/version control assets?

title: Assets to developers
description: Do the developers have all assets?

title: Possible
description: Are all designs possible (or easy enough) to implement?

title: Design review
description: Have the designs been peer reviewed by other Futu designers

title: Design approval
description: Have all the stakeholders approved the designs?

title: Design awareness
description: Have all the stakeholders seen the designs?

title: Brand
description: Is our design aligned with the brand

title: PO incentives
description: What are the incentives for the PO?
help_text: Think also about bonus schemes, personal ambition etc.

title: Release
description: Is there anything unknown about the release process?
help_text: Test release build process, walk through acceptance and deployment/store release steps.

title: Postpone
description: Is there anything in the backlog which could be postponed to the next release?

title: Weekend work
description: What is the agreement about weekend work?
help_text: Who decides, how to avoid undue peer pressure, any extra compensation?

title: Confidentiality
description: What can I tell inside Futurice?

title: Sensitive data
description: Does the project include any sensitive personal data?

title: Open source clause
description: Does the contract include our open source clause?

title: Open source licences
description: What are allowed/forbidden open source licenses?

title: Libraries
description: Is there any limitations when in comes to choosing libraries, frameworks etc.?
help_text: Some organisation have limitations in the form of a blacklist (or white-list) for 3rd party libraries.

title: IPR ownership
description: Who own the Intellectual property rights?

title: Working location
description: Does the contract stipulate where the work should be carried out?

title: Obligations
description: What, if any, are the contractual obligation the customer has to fulfil to enable project success?
help_text: Think about required upstream changes, delivered information, PO availability

title: Communication
description: What is the most important thing to improve related to inside team communication?

title: On-boarding
description: What information was missing from the on-boarding?
help_text: If there are people who joined after the project started.

title: Constraints
description: What is the most significant change in the constraints since the beginning?
help_text: Budget, scope, schedule

title: Backlog
description: How happy are we with the backlog? How can we make it better?

title: Value driven
description: Are we working on the most valuable item?

title: Feedback
description: What is the most relevant feedback we have received from the end-user so far?

title: Cancelled
description: If the customer would decide to cancel the project what would be the reason?

title: Disappointment
description: In which way have we disappointed the customer the most?

title: Team forming
description: How well is the team working as a team and how could it be better?

title: Haven't told
description: What is the biggest thing we haven't told the customer.

title: Time left
description: Based on the current burn-rate how long will the budget still last

title: Value creation
description: What is the most valuable thing we have done for the customer so far?

title: Customer
description: What is the most surprising thing you learned about the customer?

title: Team change
description: What in the team set up would you most like to change?

title: Tech. change
description: What technological aspect would you most like to change?

title: Assumptions
description: Are there any assumptions you made in the beginning which did not hold and what is the impact?

title: Travel
description: If the project crosses borders, what is the plan with regards to travelling?

title: Other costs
description: Who pays for project expenses (think of travel, licence and other costs)

title: Multiple locations
description: If your team is not all sitting at the same location, how often do you co-locate or rotate team members?

title: New information
description: If we knew at the start what we know now, what would we have done different?

title: Technical debt
description: Is the amount of technical debt we have created acceptable?

title: Things to change
description: What 3 things would you like to change?

title: Team motivation
description: What direction is the team motivation going?

title: Happy customer
description: Is the customer happier than at the start of the project?

title: Surprises
description: What has been the biggest surprise in the project so far?

title: Team changes
description: What is the difference between the on-boarding of original team members vs those who joined later?

title: Business case
description: Compared to the beginning, what has changed in the customer's business case?

title: Continue
description: Why should we continue with the project

title: Budget
description: Are we currently ahead or behind our expectations from the beginning of the project.
help_text: Think about budget, scope and schedule.

title: What changed?
description: Compared to the beginning, what is the most important thing that has changed?

title: Getting in the flow
description: How do you help others get into the flow?
help_text: You can make agreements about disturbing, working hours when to plan meetings etc.

title: Burn-rate
description: When the team is fully running how much budget is used per week?
help_text: Fully running means the team after ramp-up so based on the normal allocation of the team.

title: Credentials
description: Do all the team members have all the relevant credentials

title: Scrum budget
description: How much budget/time is reserved for retrospectives/ scrum activities?

title: UAT support
description: How much budget/time is reserved for supporting user acceptance testing?

title: Deployment
description: How much budget/time is reserved for deployment to production?

title: Cancel
description: What are the most likely scenarios in which the customer would cancel the entire project?

title: Extra work
description: How do we avoid doing extra work (not part of what is agreed) for free?

title: PM budget
description: How much budget is reserved for PM services?
help_text: PM services are things like invoicing, reporting, meetings, finding new team members, ....

title: PM services
description: What PM services are required to be done by the team? And is this budgeted?
help_text: Think about invoicing, reporting, meetings, finding new team members, ....

title: QA roles
description: Are there dedicated QA specialists available and what is their role?

title: Our motivation
description: Why don't we just walk away from the project?

title: QA Budget
description: How much budget is reserved for QA?

title: Easier
description: Given the business objectives and constraints, can the project be done easier?
help_text: If there is something, there could be a lack of understanding.

title: Reporting
description: What is expected in terms of progress reporting?

title: Product backlog
description: Who does the invoicing?

title: Sprint backlog
description: Where is the sprint backlog?

title: Hour marking
description: How should the hours be marked?

title: Remote work
description: Can we work remotely on Friday?

title: Previous projects
description: What case in Futuhistory most resembles this case and what where the biggest problems?

title: Tech. know-how
description: How well does the customer understand tech.?

title: Distance to PO
description: How far are we sitting from the PO?

title: Tools
description: Is there a limitation on which tools we can use for backlog management?

title: Tools
description: Is there a limitation on which tools we can use for issue tracking?

title: New team member
description: Scenario: A new team member joins. How long does it take that person to be up to speed?

title: Environment
description: How much control do we have on the working environment?

title: Demos
description: Who is present during the demos?

title: Demo frequency
description: How often do we have a demo?

title: Metrics
description: Which metrics do we use to track the projects?

title: Optimism
description: When estimating how can we temper our own optimism?

title: DoD
description: What is the definition of done?

title: Sprint length
description: How long are the sprints?

title: Retrospectives
description: How often do we schedule retrospectives and who arranges them?

title: Product backlog
description: Who can add/remove items from the product backlog?

title: Product backlog
description: Where is the product backlog?

title: Legacy code
description: What is the quality of the current code base?

title: Repository
description: Where is the code?

title: Dependencies
description: Can we influence the features of dependent services?
help_text: Can we modify/ add an api we are using?

title: 3rd Party libraries
description: Are we free to choose frameworks, libraries etc.?

title: End2End
description: What is needed to get a working E2E environment?

title: Documentation
description: What documentation is required?

title: Dependencies
description: What are the external dependencies?

title: First release
description: What is needs to be set up before we can deliver the first working software?

title: Customer brand
description: Do we have brand guidelines?

title: Release
description: Who releases the application to the store?

title: Deployment
description: Are we able to deploy on production?

title: Account manager
description: Who is the account manager?

title: Support team
description: Who is supporting the team?

title: Core team
description: Who is part of the core team?

title: Other commitments
description: What other commitments does the team have?

title: Industry
description: What do we know of the industry?

title: Team size
description: Are there any planned changes in the team size?

title: Plans
description: Does anybody in the team have holidays/absences planned?

title: Experience
description: How well do we know the technology used?

title: Experience
description: How much experience do we have with this type of project?
help_text: This is related to the project set-up not the technology or other competences used

title: No sayer
description: If the customer pushes for more features on top of the agreed scope, who will say no to them?
help_text: Saying no is not easy, think if you are comfortable saying no.

title: Biggest concern
description: What is the biggest concern of the PO?

title: PM Triangle
description: What is most important schedule, scope or budget?
help_text: If there is a problem. Is the customer more likely to add people, remove feature or extend deadline?

title: Platform support
description: A new client OS is released during the project: are updates due to this in or outside the scope?

title: Known Unknowns
description: What is the biggest unknown in the project?

title: MoSCoW
description: Which fraction of the backlog is must vs. should or could?

title: Deadline
description: Is there any hard deadline?
help_text: Think about media campaigns, special events, seasonal buying related to the service?

title: Lifetime service
description: How long is the service expected to be used?

title: Platform support
description: Which OS/platform/� versions do we support?

title: Delay impact
description: What happens to the customer's business case if the release is a month later?

title: Release planning
description: How far from the launch day are we when we have burned half of the total budget?

title: Project end
description: When is the project finished?

title: Scope change
description: How do we know if something is outside the scope?

title: Scope change
description: Who negotiates scope changes?

title: Underestimate
description: If an item is larger than was estimated during sprint planning, what is most likely to happen?

title: Revenue
description: How much does the customer expect to spend on Futurice before the end of the project?

title: Budget check
description: How often do we check how we are doing on budget?

title: Timeline
description: How much budget do we expect to be used before we deliver the first working version?

title: Timeline
description: How much time is there reserved for bug fixing?

title: Timeline
description: When does the customer expect the project to be released?

title: Responsibility
description: Whose ass on the customer's is on the line if the project fails utterly?

title: Problem
description: What problem does this service try to solve?

title: Project aim
description: What is the aim of the customer with this project?
help_text: Generally something like reduce costs, get more users, retain users, change business model...

title: Why
description: What is the reason the customer wants us to do the project?

title: Vision
description: What is the long-term vision of the service?

title: Release frequency
description: How frequent are production releases?

title: Product Owner
description: How long has the PO been working for the customer organization?

title: SW buyer
description: Has the customer a long track record of buying software?

title: Dependencies
description: Can we easily communicate with technical people of services we depend on?

title: PO time
description: How much time does the PO have available for the project?

title: Assets
description: How do we get customer assets?
help_text: Think about texts, logo's brand material etc.

title: Previous projects
description: What other projects have we done for the customer and what were the biggest problems?

title: Approval
description: Who approves the final products?

title: Key players
description: Who are the key players in the customer organization?

title: Agile
description: How agile is the customer?

title: Digital maturity
description: What do we know of the customer digital maturity?

title: Public reference
description: Is the case a public reference case?

title: Feedback
description: How do we get customer satisfaction feedback?

title: End users
description: Who are the end users?

title: Happy customer
description: What is an outcome that would make the customer jump with joy?

title: ROI
description: How does the customer get the invested money back?

title: Stakeholders
description: Do we have access to stakeholders?

title: End users
description: Do we have access to end users?

title: Current service
description: What is the current service/application?

title: Verify feedback
description: How can we verify customer satisfaction from higher up in the organization?
help_text: It can happen that the PO/PM, we are working with is happy, but the higher up management is not.

title: Autonomy
description: Who has autonomy to change the scope, budget or schedule?

title: Product Owner
description: Who is the PO?

title: Overrun Pain
description: We spend 250 extra hours on the project. Who pays?

title: Special NDA
description: Are there any special NDA concerns?
help_text: Like for example is there a 100.000� damages clause?

title: LCM plans
description: Will there be an LCM continuation?

title: Warranty: time
description: How long do the warranty obligations last?

title: Contract clauses
description: Are there any conditional clauses?
help_text: Like we get 20% more if the user base growth with 10000 daily users.

title: Sales rate
description: What is the sales rate?

title: Budget
description: What is the budget in person-days?

title: Proposal location
description: Where is the proposal?

title: Contract location
description: Where is the contract?

title: Contract type
description: What is the contract type?
help_text: Time and material, Fixed price/scope/schedule, Target price

title: Deliverables
description: What are the deliverables?

title: End
description: When does the project end?
help_text: When: think about schedule, contract, release activity etc.

title: Warranty
description: What is our warranty obligation?

title: Warranty: terms
description: Who determines which bugs are warranty bugs?
